A

acceptingTrade - Variable in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.MarketplaceActivity
 
acceptTrade(TextView, String) - Method in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.MarketplaceActivity
Check that the user and trades have been loaded in properly before proceeding to physically process the trade in the DB
acceptTradeDB(TextView, String) - Method in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.MarketplaceActivity
Method called for a User (the buyer) to accept a trade; we need to process this for the current user as well as for the person who posted the trade (the seller), finally we also need to delete this trade from the trades collection in the DB; this will show a helpful toast message if the buyer does not have enough enough resources, or if previous trade actions are still being processed; when this method is invoked, it sets a flag, acceptingTrade, that only resolves once this trade is entirely finished being processed (logically and physically in DB); once done, it automatically refreshes the user's attributes at the top of the screen
action() - Method in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.ActionTimerActivity
To be implemented by the concrete class; this differs depending on whether we want to chop wood, fish for fish, or battle monsters
action() - Method in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.CendanaForestTimerActivity
On this page, since it's the forest, we want to chop wood
action() - Method in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.EcopondTimerActivity
On this page, since it's the Ecopond, we want to fish
action() - Method in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.SagaBattlegroundTimerActivity
On this page, since it's the battleground, we want to deal damage to monsters
actionAndRefresh() - Method in class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.ActionTimerActivity
Call the action() method, which has the potential to update the TextViews; there is also the check that the User has actually loaded in (since it is loaded in asynchronously)
ActionTimerActivity - Class in com.example.littleync.gameActivities
Abstract class we implement for woodchopping, fishing, and combat.
ActionTimerActivity(String) - Constructor for class com.example.littleync.gameActivities.ActionTimerActivity
Constructor for this abstract class which just sets the Log print for us to debug

addition_isCorrect() - Method in class com.example.littleync.ExampleUnitTest
 
addTrade(String) - Method in class com.example.littleync.model.User
Adds a trade to the local User object, physically adds to both the current trades list and the newTrades list; we need to ensure the local User object does not have more than 5 trades, but when we write to the DB, we need this separately maintained newTrades list
addWood(int) - Method in class com.example.littleync.model.User
Add a specified amount of wood
